subject: Re: [junit] JUnit html report
msgSnippet: ... For example, here s a dashboard for Ron and Chet s Shooting project... * http://tinyurl.com/224bwu* (the failures are because I don t have all the
messageBody:
On 10/15/07, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Ibrahim,
>
> Ant is the simplest way I know to get an HTML report. There's also
> JUnit Factory's free dashboard, if your code is freely licensed.
> Once you've decided on a simple reporting tool to use, that will
> affect what kind of complicated configuration you'll need to do to
> report your SOA stats. Thanks,
>
> David
>


For example, here's a dashboard for Ron and Chet's Shooting project...

* http://tinyurl.com/224bwu*

(the failures are because I don't have all the necessary images - not R&C's
fault at all)

--
Kevin

http://www.junitfactory.com
You send us code. We send you tests. For free.
One million tests served.
